Posts.Content: Thank you, GP will be back in surgery on Tuesday. I’ll call again and explain I’m anxious to be seen.
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?

Posts.Content: Mistymoley, thanks so much for the quick response. I didn’t want to appear to be overreacting.  I ignored the BCC for a long time and don’t want to run the risk of doing it again if there is something that needs attention.  I will make a call to the surgery in the morning and request a referral. I will se how that goes.  Thanks again.
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?

Posts.Content: Thank you all so much. I made a call this morning and doctor has rang me back and suggested that I see a dermatologist first. I am going to do that and should have an appointment in the next couple of weeks.  The online community is such great support!!
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?

Posts.Content: Hi All, I hope you don’t mind me posting this question. I am wondering about others experiences.  I was at my doctor this week and one thing that I asked her to check was one of my breasts. I have had an itchy nipple for months and I am not sure if I am more aware now but this nipple is considerably larger than my other. She wasn’t concerned as there was no lump. Earlier this year I had a BCC removed (type of skin cancer) and I think I am now more aware of changes to my skin/body.  Should I be worried??? Has anyone had further tests without a lump?  Thanks for reading and any replies!
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?

Posts.Content: Hi All I got a referral to the breast clinic and was seen today.   Doctor seems happy that all is ok. This was by feeling my breasts. As standard I will get a mammogram in a couple of months but they obviously didn’t feel the need today.  Should I take comfort in this?  Also told if nipple continues to itch in a few months thy may do a biopsy.  Confused :-|
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?
